trans-unit.source: How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account
trans-unit.target: How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to manage Streaming Endpoints using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to manage Streaming Endpoints using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account

trans-unit.source: In Microsoft Azure Media Services, a Streaming Endpoint represents a streaming service that can deliver content directly to a client player application, or to a Content Delivery Network (CDN) for further distribution.
trans-unit.target: In Microsoft Azure Media Services, a Streaming Endpoint represents a streaming service that can deliver content directly to a client player application, or to a Content Delivery Network (CDN) for further distribution.

trans-unit.source: Media Services also provides seamless Azure CDN integration.
trans-unit.target: Media Services also provides seamless Azure CDN integration.

trans-unit.source: The outbound stream from a StreamingEndpoint service can be a live stream, or a video on demand Asset in your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: The outbound stream from a StreamingEndpoint service can be a live stream, or a video on demand Asset in your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can control the capacity of the Streaming Endpoint service to handle growing bandwidth needs by adjusting scale units (also known as streaming units).
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can control the capacity of the Streaming Endpoint service to handle growing bandwidth needs by adjusting scale units (also known as streaming units).

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to allocate one or more scale units for applications in production environment.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to allocate one or more scale units for applications in production environment.

trans-unit.source: Scale units provide you with both dedicated egress capacity that can be purchased in increments of 200 Mbps and additional functionality which functionality which includes: <link><linkText>dynamic packaging</linkText><title></title></link>, CDN integration, and advanced configuration.
trans-unit.target: Scale units provide you with both dedicated egress capacity that can be purchased in increments of 200 Mbps and additional functionality which functionality which includes: <link><linkText>dynamic packaging</linkText><title></title></link>, CDN integration, and advanced configuration.

trans-unit.source: Note that you are only billed when your StreamingEndpoint is in running state.
trans-unit.target: Note that you are only billed when your StreamingEndpoint is in running state.

trans-unit.source: This topic gives an overview of the main functionalities that are provided by Streaming Endpoints.
trans-unit.target: This topic gives an overview of the main functionalities that are provided by Streaming Endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The topic also shows how to use the Azure Management Portal to manage streaming endpoints.
trans-unit.target: The topic also shows how to use the Azure Management Portal to manage streaming endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Adding and Deleting Streaming Endpoints
trans-unit.target: Adding and Deleting Streaming Endpoints

trans-unit.source: You can add or remove streaming endpoints using .NET SDK, REST API, or Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can add or remove streaming endpoints using .NET SDK, REST API, or Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To add\delete streaming endpoint using the Portal, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To add\delete streaming endpoint using the Portal, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Media Services.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Then, click the name of the media service.
trans-unit.target: Then, click the name of the media service.

trans-unit.source: Select the STREAMING ENDPOINTS page.
trans-unit.target: Select the STREAMING ENDPOINTS page.

trans-unit.source: Click the ADD or DELETE button at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the ADD or DELETE button at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Note that the default streaming endpoint cannot be deleted.
trans-unit.target: Note that the default streaming endpoint cannot be deleted.

trans-unit.source: Click the START button to start the streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Click the START button to start the streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Click on the name of the streaming endpoint to configure it.
trans-unit.target: Click on the name of the streaming endpoint to configure it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Streaming Endpoint page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Streaming Endpoint page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By default you can have up to two streaming endpoints.
trans-unit.target: By default you can have up to two streaming endpoints.

trans-unit.source: If you need to request more, see <link><linkText>Quotas and limitations</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to request more, see <link><linkText>Quotas and limitations</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Scale the Streaming Endpoint
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Scale the Streaming Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Streaming units provide you with both dedicated egress capacity that can be purchased in increments of 200 Mbps and additional functionality which currently includes <link><linkText>dynamic packaging capabilities</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Streaming units provide you with both dedicated egress capacity that can be purchased in increments of 200 Mbps and additional functionality which currently includes <link><linkText>dynamic packaging capabilities</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: By default, streaming is configured in a shared-instance model for which server resources (for example, compute, egress capacity, etc.)
trans-unit.target: By default, streaming is configured in a shared-instance model for which server resources (for example, compute, egress capacity, etc.)

trans-unit.source: are shared with all other users.
trans-unit.target: are shared with all other users.

trans-unit.source: To improve a streaming throughput, it is recommended to purchase Streaming Units.
trans-unit.target: To improve a streaming throughput, it is recommended to purchase Streaming Units.

trans-unit.source: You can scale using .NET SDK, REST API, or Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can scale using .NET SDK, REST API, or Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To change the number of streaming units using the Portal, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To change the number of streaming units using the Portal, do the following:

trans-unit.source: To specify the number of streaming units, select the SCALE tab and move the reserved capacity slider.
trans-unit.target: To specify the number of streaming units, select the SCALE tab and move the reserved capacity slider.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Press the SAVE button to save your changes.
trans-unit.target: Press the SAVE button to save your changes.

trans-unit.source: The allocation of any new streaming units takes around 20 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: The allocation of any new streaming units takes around 20 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: Currently, going from any positive value of streaming units back to none, can disable on-demand streaming for up to an hour.
trans-unit.target: Currently, going from any positive value of streaming units back to none, can disable on-demand streaming for up to an hour.

trans-unit.source: The highest number of units specified for the 24-hour period is used in calculating the cost.
trans-unit.target: The highest number of units specified for the 24-hour period is used in calculating the cost.

trans-unit.source: For information about pricing details, see <link><linkText>Media Services Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about pricing details, see <link><linkText>Media Services Pricing Details</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configuring the Streaming Endpoint
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configuring the Streaming Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Streaming Endpoint enables you to configure the following properties when you have at least 1 scale unit:
trans-unit.target: Streaming Endpoint enables you to configure the following properties when you have at least 1 scale unit:

trans-unit.source: Access control
trans-unit.target: Access control

trans-unit.source: Custom host names
trans-unit.target: Custom host names

trans-unit.source: Cache control
trans-unit.target: Cache control

trans-unit.source: Cross site access policies
trans-unit.target: Cross site access policies

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about these properties, see <link><linkText>StreamingEndpoint</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about these properties, see <link><linkText>StreamingEndpoint</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can configure these properties using .NET SDK, REST API, or Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can configure these properties using .NET SDK, REST API, or Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To change the number of streaming units using the Portal, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To change the number of streaming units using the Portal, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Select the streaming endpoint that you want to configure.
trans-unit.target: Select the streaming endpoint that you want to configure.

trans-unit.source: Select the CONFIGURE tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the CONFIGURE tab.

trans-unit.source: A brief description of the fields follows.
trans-unit.target: A brief description of the fields follows.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure origin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure origin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Set the maximum caching period that will be specified in the cache control header of HTTP responses.
trans-unit.target: Set the maximum caching period that will be specified in the cache control header of HTTP responses.

trans-unit.source: This value will not override the maximum cache value that have been set explicitly on the blob content.
trans-unit.target: This value will not override the maximum cache value that have been set explicitly on the blob content.

trans-unit.source: Specify IP addresses that would be allowed to connect to the published streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specify IP addresses that would be allowed to connect to the published streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If no IP addresses specified, any IP address would be able to connect.
trans-unit.target: If no IP addresses specified, any IP address would be able to connect.

trans-unit.source: Specify configuration for Akamai signature header authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify configuration for Akamai signature header authentication.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a cross domain access policy for Adobe Flash clients (for more information see, <link><linkText>Cross-domain policy file specification</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a cross domain access policy for Adobe Flash clients (for more information see, <link><linkText>Cross-domain policy file specification</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: As well as client access policy for Microsoft Silverlight clients (for more information, see <link><linkText>Making a Service Available Across Domain Boundaries</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: As well as client access policy for Microsoft Silverlight clients (for more information, see <link><linkText>Making a Service Available Across Domain Boundaries</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure custom host names by clicking the configure button.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure custom host names by clicking the configure button.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the CustomHostNames property in the StreamingEndpont topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the CustomHostNames property in the StreamingEndpont topic.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Enable Azure CDN integration
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Enable Azure CDN integration

trans-unit.source: You can specify to enable the Azure CDN integration for a Streaming Endpoint (it is disabled by default.)
trans-unit.target: You can specify to enable the Azure CDN integration for a Streaming Endpoint (it is disabled by default.)

trans-unit.source: To set the Azure CDN integration to true:
trans-unit.target: To set the Azure CDN integration to true:

trans-unit.source: The streaming endpoint must have at least one streaming (scale) unit.
trans-unit.target: The streaming endpoint must have at least one streaming (scale) unit.

trans-unit.source: If later you want to set scale units to 0, you must first disable the CDN integration.
trans-unit.target: If later you want to set scale units to 0, you must first disable the CDN integration.

trans-unit.source: By default when you create a new streaming endpoint one streaming unit is automatically set.
trans-unit.target: By default when you create a new streaming endpoint one streaming unit is automatically set.

trans-unit.source: The streaming endpoint must be in a stopped state.
trans-unit.target: The streaming endpoint must be in a stopped state.

trans-unit.source: Once the CDN gets enabled, you can start the streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Once the CDN gets enabled, you can start the streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: It could take up to 90 min for the Azure CDN integration to get enabled.
trans-unit.target: It could take up to 90 min for the Azure CDN integration to get enabled.

trans-unit.source: It takes up to two hours for the changes to be active across all the CDN POPs.
trans-unit.target: It takes up to two hours for the changes to be active across all the CDN POPs.

trans-unit.source: CDN integration is enabled in all the Azure data centers: US West, US East, North Europe, West Europe, Japan West, Japan East, South East Asia and East Asia.
trans-unit.target: CDN integration is enabled in all the Azure data centers: US West, US East, North Europe, West Europe, Japan West, Japan East, South East Asia and East Asia.

trans-unit.source: Once it is enabled, the following configurations get disabled: Custom Host Names and Access Control.
trans-unit.target: Once it is enabled, the following configurations get disabled: Custom Host Names and Access Control.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Streaming Endpoint Enable CDN</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Streaming Endpoint Enable CDN</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Additional considerations
trans-unit.target: Additional considerations

trans-unit.source: When CDN is enabled for a streaming endpoint, clients cannot request content directly from the origin.
trans-unit.target: When CDN is enabled for a streaming endpoint, clients cannot request content directly from the origin.

trans-unit.source: If you need the ability to test your content with or without CDN you can create another streaming endpoint that isn’t CDN enabled.
trans-unit.target: If you need the ability to test your content with or without CDN you can create another streaming endpoint that isn’t CDN enabled.

trans-unit.source: Your streaming endpoint hostname remains the same after enabling CDN.
trans-unit.target: Your streaming endpoint hostname remains the same after enabling CDN.

trans-unit.source: You don’t need to make any changes to your media services workflow after CDN is enabled.
trans-unit.target: You don’t need to make any changes to your media services workflow after CDN is enabled.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your streaming endpoint hostname is strasbourg.streaming.mediaservices.windows.net, after enabling CDN, the exact same hostname is used.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your streaming endpoint hostname is strasbourg.streaming.mediaservices.windows.net, after enabling CDN, the exact same hostname is used.

trans-unit.source: For new streaming endpoints, you can enable CDN simply by creating a new endpoint; for existing streaming endpoints, you will need to first stop the endpoint and then enable the CDN.
trans-unit.target: For new streaming endpoints, you can enable CDN simply by creating a new endpoint; for existing streaming endpoints, you will need to first stop the endpoint and then enable the CDN.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, <link><linkText>Announcing Azure Media Services integration with Azure CDN (Content Delivery Network)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see, <link><linkText>Announcing Azure Media Services integration with Azure CDN (Content Delivery Network)</linkText><title></title></link>.
